description: Protesters take to the streets of Jerusalem to voice their opposition to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s handling of the war in Gaza and demand the return of all hostages. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.
title: Jerusalem protesters demand end to war in Gaza

description: Lisbon streetcar crash leaves at least 15 dead
title: Lisbon streetcar crash leaves at least 15 dead

description: China just held one of its biggest-ever military parades, and Chinese President Xi Jinping was joined by leaders from a host of countries at odds with the U.S. and its allies. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing on the message sent to the West.
title: Isolated leaders attend China's massive military parade

author: Daniella Silva
description: Immigration enforcement has gone hand-in-hand with the Trump administration sending National Guard troops to Los Angeles and in the federal takeover of Washington, D.C.
title: Chicago and Boston officials brace for a spike in immigration raids

description: Federal judge rules Harvard grant freeze was illegal
title: Federal judge rules Harvard grant freeze was illegal

description: Florida Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo says the state will work to get rid of all vaccine mandates. "Here's the Scoop" host Yasmin Vossoughian speaks with NBC News medical contributor Doctor Vin Gupta about the potential for other states to follow suit. Listen to today’s full episode of “Here’s the Scoop” wherever you get your podcasts.
title: Here's the Scoop: Florida and its vaccine mandates

description: Hot mic captures Xi and Putin discussing immortality
title: Hot mic captures Xi and Putin discussing immortality

description: A federal judge in Boston ordered the Trump administration to unfreeze nearly $2.2 billion in federal grants to Harvard. NBC News’ Gary Grumbach reports on the legal setback for the Trump administration.
title: Federal judge rules Harvard grant freeze was illegal, violated free speech

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: Federal agents are violating a court order that prohibits them from racially profiling Latinos in Southern California as the directive winds it way through the appeal process, immigrant advocates and local officials say.
title: Why a court order barring ICE from targeting people based on their race isn't being enforced

description: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty in Matthew Perry's death
title: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty in Matthew Perry's death

description: Georgia elementary schools bring back cursive writing
title: Georgia elementary schools bring back cursive writing

description: In an interview with the TODAY Show, NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell didn't rule out a performance by Taylor Swift during this year's Super Bowl halftime show.
title: Taylor Swift is a 'maybe' to perform at the Super Bowl

description: Venezuelan president shows off gift from Xi Jinping
title: Venezuelan president shows off gift from Xi Jinping

author: Zoë Richards
description: The Trump administration has targeted Democratic-run cities, with the president suggesting Wednesday that New Orleans could be on his list.
title: Dick Durbin calls for Senate hearing on Trump's threats to send troops to cities like Chicago

description: Texas nanny's driving lesson goes horribly wrong
title: Texas nanny's driving lesson goes horribly wrong

description: The Los Angeles woman known as the “Ketamine Queen” pleaded guilty to five federal counts in connection with the fatal overdose of “Friends” actor Matthew Perry in 2023. 42-year-old Jasveen Sangha is the 5th and final defendant to plead guilty and remains in custody.
title: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty over Matthew Perry's death

description: Vances lay flowers at Annunciation Catholic Church
title: Vances lay flowers at Annunciation Catholic Church

description: Maine parents turn to landlines to keep kids connected
title: Maine parents turn to landlines to keep kids connected

author: Erika Edwards
description: Excessive scrolling on smartphones while on the toilet can lead to itchy, painful hemorrhoids, finds a new study.
title: Here's why you shouldn't take your smartphone into the bathroom

description: Marjorie Taylor Greene vows to name Epstein clients
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene vows to name Epstein clients

description: Putin says Zelenskyy should come to Moscow for peace talks
title: Putin says Zelenskyy should come to Moscow for peace talks

description: Florida will become the first U.S. state to eliminate all vaccine mandates, including in public schools. Florida Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo says vaccine mandates drip “with distain and slavery” and he doesn’t believe the government has the right to tell citizens what to put in their bodies.
title: Vaccine mandates drip ‘with disdain and slavery’

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump on Wednesday suggested he could deploy federal troops to New Orleans in his latest threat to use the federal government to crack down on crime in a Democrat-run city.“We’re going to be going to maybe Louisiana, and you have New Orleans, which has a crime problem," Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.
title: Trump suggests he could send troops to New Orleans in another crime crackdown

author: Daniel Arkin
description: The Los Angeles woman known as the “Ketamine Queen” pleaded guilty Wednesday to five federal counts in connection with the fatal overdose of “Friends” actor Matthew Perry in 2023, according to a spokesman for the U.S.
title: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty in Matthew Perry’s overdose death

description: President Trump weighed in on China's military parade and the presence of leaders from Russia, North Korea and Iran. "I thought it was a beautiful ceremony. I thought it was very, very impressive, but I understood the reason they were doing it, and they were hoping I was watching, and I was watching," he said.
title: Trump says he was 'watching' China military parade

description: Jason and Travis Kelce shared their favorite reactions to the news of Travis and Taylor Swift’s engagement during an episode of "New Heights."
title: Travis Kelce’s favorite response to his engagement news

description: Epstein survivors rally for the release of case files
title: Epstein survivors rally for the release of case files

description: Rep. Thomas Massie, a Republican from Kentucky, talks about the White House's response to a discharge petition he's filed to force a floor vote to get the DOJ to release all the files from the Jeffrey Epstein case. A White House official has said, supporting the discharge petition would be viewed as "a hostile act."
title: Rep. Massie's push for Epstein files transparency

description: Lisa Phillips, a Jeffrey Epstein accuser, says she and other survivors are working to compile their own list of abusers who they encountered "regularly" in the Epstein world.
title: 'We know the names': Epstein accusers will compile their own client list

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump meets with Polish President Nawrocki at the White House.
title: Trump meets with president of Poland

description: Trump shares video of strike on Venezuela cartel boat
title: Trump shares video of strike on Venezuela cartel boat

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: For the third week in a row, Taylor Swift has been the focus of a football podcast.
title: Travis Kelce says he is still 'giddy' over engagement to Taylor Swift

description: Travis Kelce is opening up about his recent engagement to Taylor Swift on the latest episode of his podcast “New Heights.” Travis said one of his favorite reactions on the internet came from the city of Cleveland’s official social media account which posted, "Local man and his new fiancée stun in engagement pics.”
title: Travis Kelce Talks Engagement on Latest Episode of ‘New Heights’

description: Carmel Gat was killed by Hamas while in captivity in 2024 after being taken hostage from Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. Her cousin, Gil Dickmann, has called for an end to the war in Gaza and accused Israeli PM Netanyahu of "sacrificing" the remaining hostages.
title: Cousin of hostage killed by Hamas calls for end of war in Gaza

description: Gaza journalist Mariam Dagga, who was killed in an Israeli attack on Nasser hospital on Aug. 25, wrote a will and gave it to her friend, an NBC News cameraman, to be published in the event of her death. It included a message to her 13-year-old son, Gaith.
title: Gaza journalist gave NBC News cameraman will before her death

description: China held a massive military parade in Beijing on Wednesday where President Xi Jinping was joined by the leaders of Russia, North Korea, Iran and 23 other countries in a dramatic show of strength and unity. It's the first time ever that Xi, Kim Jong Un and Vladimir Putin have appeared together. NBC’s Janis Mackey Frayer reports for TODAY on what it could mean for U.S. national security and its standing in the world.
title: Leaders of Russia, North Korea, Iran Attend China's Military Parade

description: A federal appeals court has blocked President Donald Trump’s use of a centuries-old wartime law that he had invoked to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members. The White House had justified these deportations under the Alien Enemies Act which gives the president those powers in the event of an invasion or war, but the judges ruled 2-to-1 that there was no invasion by a foreign power. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Appeals Court Blocks Trump Deportations Under Wartime Law

author: Christian Orozco
description: Congress releases its first batch of investigative files on Jeffrey Epstein as accusers call for more to be released.
title: First batch of Epstein files released and Trump addresses the rumors surrounding his health: Morning Rundown

description: Putin thanks Kim Jong Un for military assistance
title: Putin thanks Kim Jong Un for military assistance

author: Pilar Melendez
description: Justin Morello used to believe it was important to spend his rare TV time only watching critically acclaimed shows with a certain prestige
title: Is 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' actually a couples show?

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Dan Kleban is betting that something is brewing in Maine, and he’s not talking about his company’s latest pale ale.
title: Maine brewery owner joins race to take on GOP Sen. Susan Collins

author: Erik Ortiz
description: Families of the victims of a 2023 mass shooting in Maine along with dozens of survivors intend to file negligence lawsuits Wednesday against the U.S. government.
title: Maine mass shooting survivors to file suit against U.S. government for negligence

description: Man discovers plane seat in Potomac River
title: Man discovers plane seat in Potomac River

description: Trump family's wealth grew by $5B after crypto launch
title: Trump family's wealth grew by $5B after crypto launch

author: Gary Grumbach
description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday blocked the Trump administration from using the 18th-century Alien Enemies Act to remove alleged Venezuelan gang members from the U.S.
title: Federal court blocks deportations of alleged gang members under Alien Enemies Act

author: Jing Feng
description: Boomers are the only generation planning to increase their holiday shopping budgets this year, according to PwC's 2025 Holiday Outlook.
title: Gen Z slashes holiday budgets ahead of shopping season

description: China holds military parade
title: China holds military parade

description: China showed off new weaponry in a military parade attended by Russia's President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. The United States had no official representatives at the parade, which Western leaders are mostly skipping in part because of Putin’s attendance.
title: China puts on display of force with military parade

author: Dan De Luce
description: Senate Intelligence Committee Vice Chairman Mark Warner said Tuesday that he is being blocked from a scheduled oversight meeting after interference from far-right activist Laura Loomer
title: Intelligence meeting canceled after attacks by far-right activist Laura Loomer, Democratic senator says

description: Thousands of fake Labubus intercepted at U.S. border
title: Thousands of fake Labubus intercepted at U.S. border

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Sen. Bill Cassidy, chair of the Health Committee, declined to elaborate on “oversight” he plans to conduct of RFK Jr. after the CDC director was fired and others quit.
title: Key GOP senator declines to elaborate on planned 'oversight' of RFK Jr. after CDC exodus

description: Cardi B found not liable of assault allegations
title: Cardi B found not liable of assault allegations

description: Landslide kills more than 1,000 people in Sudan
title: Landslide kills more than 1,000 people in Sudan

author: Dennis Romero
description: A shipment of fake Labubu dolls that would be worth more than half a million dollars if the items were genuine was intercepted last week at Seattle's airport, authorities said.U.S.
title: Over $500,000 worth of fake Labubu dolls intercepted at Seattle airport, CBP says

description: McDonald’s brings back Extra Value Meals
title: McDonald’s brings back Extra Value Meals
